lfsettings.lfoptions:
#----------------------------------------------------------- # modelling and reporting options #-----------------------------------------------------------
# options to turn hydrological modules on/off
# use inflow data
# option to compute indicators
# option to initialize Lisflood
# option to read/write NetCDF
#----------------------------------------------------------- # report time series #----------------------------------------------------------- # report discharge TS
# report gauges and sites
# report reservoirs and lakes
#----------------------------------------------------------- # report maps #----------------------------------------------------------- # report state maps
# report end maps
# report maps

lfuser.group:
************************************************************** netCDF parameters **************************************************************
!-- Optimization of netCDF I/O through chunking and caching.
The option "NetCDFTimeChunks" may take the following values: - "-1" : Load everything upfront - "[positive integer number]" : Chunk size defined by user - "auto" : Let xarray to decide
The option "MapsCaching" may take the following values: - "True" : Cache maps during execution - "False" : No caching
************************************************************** PARALLELIZED KINEMATIC ROUTING **************************************************************
!-- Parallelisation of the kinematic wave routing (via openMP multi-threading). The option "numCPUs_parallelKinematicWave" may take the following values: - "0" : auto-detection of the machine/node's number of CPUs (all CPUs are used minus 1) (do not set it if other simulations are running on the same machine/node) - "1" : serial execution (not parallel) - "2", "3", ... : manual setting of the number of parallel threads. (if exceeding the number of CPUs, the option is set to "0") -->
************************************************************** PARALLELISATION WITH NUMBA (USED IN SOILLOOP) **************************************************************
!-- Parallelisation of using Numba runtime compiled library . The option "numCPUs_parallelNumba" may take the following values: - "0" : set to NUMBA_NUM_THREADS Environment Variable (if NUMBA_NUM_THREADS is not set, will take the number of CPU cores determined by python's multiprocessing.cpu_count()) - "1" : serial execution (not parallel) - "2", "3", ... : manual setting of the number of parallel threads. (if exceeding NUMBA_NUM_THREADS, the value is set to NUMBA_NUM_THREADS) -->
************************************************************** AREA AND OUTLETS **************************************************************
This is necessary when using projected coordinates (x,y)
/discolocal/felipe/LF_pratico/lisflood/porto_amazonas/settings.xml
/perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/xdom/data/staticData/lisflood Root directory (tables and parameters)
/perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/areawithdeadsea.nc /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/work/DrinaMask.nc /sbsDrina/DrinaMask.nc /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/xdom/data/staticData/lisflood/area /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/areawithdeadsea.nc /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/sbs/pontelagoscuro_sbs.nc 70 40 0.1 -8.6 43.3 # Douro 30 30 0.1 6.0 52.0 Clone map col row cellsize xupleft yupleft 300 200 0.1 -15 25 -> Niger 3600 1500 0.1 -180 90 -> World $(PathRoot)\areamaps\areaEurope.nc $(PathRoot)\areamaps\AreaPo.nc or pcraster maps or netcdf maps e.g. Rhine areaLobith.nc Niger areaLokoja.nc Po areaPo.nc Danube areaDanube.nc Sava areaSava.nc
4447500 2422500 Pontelagoscuro 4227500 2437500 Isola /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/work/pontelagoscuro.nc /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/ec_outlets.nc /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/xdom/data/staticData/lisflood/outlets.nc" -7.85 41.15 -7.75 41.15 -7.35 41.15 -7.25 41.15 -7.15 41.15 -7.05 41.15 -5.85 41.75 # Duoro 6.15 51.85 12.25 44.95 9.95 45.15 # Po Nominal map with gauge locations (i.e cells for which simulated discharge is written to file(1,2,3 etc) lat lon (lat2 lon2 ...) or pcraster maps or netcdf maps ./mapsNetcdf/maps/outlets_World.nc $(PathMaps)/outlets.nc e.g. Lobith/Rhine 6.15 51.85 Bratislava/Danube 17.15 48.15 Niger/Lokoja 6.75 7.85 0.45 15.65
netcdf template used to copy metadata information for writing netcdf $(PathEvapo)/$(PrefixE0)
latitude map to be used for snow/ice modelling
************************************************************** TIME-RELATED CONSTANTS **************************************************************
Calendar convention
Reference day and time
timestep [seconds]
17280 5 times subrouting 21600 4 times Sub time step used for kinematic wave channel routing [seconds] Within the model,the smallest out of DtSecChannel and DtSec is used
Number of first time step in simulation
Number of last time step in simulation
1..9999 Time steps at which to write model state maps (i.e. only those maps that would be needed to define initial conditions for succeeding model run)

textvar.name: EnsMembers
textvar.comment: Number of sample to use in MonteCarlo simulations

textvar.name: nrCores
textvar.comment: Number of cores of the computer to use in MonteCarlo simulations This only works with Linux, if set to 1 no forking will be used

textvar.name: FilterSteps
UpperZoneTimeConstant
textvar.comment: default: 10 $(PathParams)/params_UpperZoneTimeConstant.nc Time constant for water in upper zone [days] This is the average time a water 'particle' remains in the reservoir if we had a stationary system (average inflow=average outflow)

textvar.name: LowerZoneTimeConstant
textvar.comment: default: 100 $(PathParams)/params_LowerZoneTimeConstant.nc Time constant for water in lower zone [days] This is the average time a water 'particle' remains in the reservoir if we had a stationary system (average inflow=average outflow)

textvar.name: GwPercValue
textvar.comment: default: 0.5 $(PathParams)/params_GwPercValue.nc Maximum rate of percolation going from the Upper to the Lower response box [mm/day]

textvar.name: GwLoss
textvar.comment: default: 0.0 $(PathParams)/params_GwLoss.nc Maximum percolation rate from the lower groundwater zone [mm/days]. GWLoss it’s lost beyond the catchment boundaries or to deep groundwater systems. A value of 0 (closed lower boundary) is recommended as a starting value.

textvar.name: LZThreshold
textvar.comment: threshold value [mm] of the water storage in the lower groundwater zone. If the water storage in the lower groundwater zone decreases below LZThreshold, the flow from the lower zone to the nearby rivers (base-flow) stops.

textvar.name: b_Xinanjiang
textvar.comment: default: 0.7 [-] $(PathParams)/params_b_Xinanjiang.nc Power in Xinanjiang distribution function [-]

textvar.name: PowerPrefFlow
textvar.comment: default: 3.5 [-] $(PathParams)/params_PowerPrefFlow.nc Power that controls increase of proportion of preferential flow with increased soil moisture storage [-]

textvar.name: CalChanMan
textvar.comment: default: 2.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_CalChanMan1.nc Multiplier [-] applied to Channel Manning's n

textvar.name: SnowMeltCoef
textvar.comment: default: 4.0 [mm C-1 day-1] $(PathParams)/params_SnowMeltCoef.nc SRM: 0.45 cm C-1 day-1 ( = 4.50 mm C-1 day-1), Kwadijk: 18 mm C-1 month-1 (= 0.59 mm C-1 day-1) See also Martinec et al., 1998.

textvar.name: CalChanMan2
textvar.comment: default: 3.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_CalChanMan2.nc Multiplier [-] applied to Channel Manning's n for second line of routing

textvar.name: LakeMultiplier
textvar.comment: default: 1.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_LakeMultiplier.nc Multiplier applied to the lake parameter A

textvar.name: adjust_Normal_Flood
textvar.comment: default: 0.8 [-] $(PathParams)/params_adjust_Normal_Flood.nc adjusting the balance between normal and flood storage big values (= closer to 1.0 = close to flood) results in keeping the outflow longer at rnormq Range 0.01 - 0.99

textvar.name: ReservoirRnormqMult
textvar.comment: default: 1.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_ReservoirRnormqMult.nc Reservoir rnormq (normal outflow) fraction of the value in table rnormq.txt range: 0.5 - 2

textvar.name: AvWaterRateThreshold
textvar.comment: default: 5.0 [mm/day] (not included in calibration) Critical amount of available water (expressed in [mm/day]!), above which 'Days Since Last Rain' parameter is set to 1

textvar.name: QSplitMult
textvar.comment: PBchange Multiplier applied to average Q to split into a second line of routing THIS NEEDS TO BE AMENDED BY ADDING THE RIGHT PATH TO $(PathParams)

textvar.name: ChanBottomWMult
textvar.comment: PBchange Multiplier applied to ChanBottomWidth

textvar.name: ChanDepthTMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier [] applied to ChanDepthThreshold

textvar.name: ChanSMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier [] applied to ChanSdXdY

textvar.name: PathMaps
textvar.comment: Static maps path /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/xdom/data/staticData/lisflood Maps path

textvar.name: PathInflow
textvar.comment: Inflow path

textvar.name: PathParams
textvar.comment: Calibration parameter path

textvar.name: PathTables
textvar.comment: Tables path

textvar.name: PathMapsTables
textvar.comment: Maps instead of tables path

textvar.name: PathSoilHyd
textvar.comment: Maps instead of tables for soil hydraulics path

textvar.name: PathMapsLandUseChange
textvar.comment: Maps for transient land use changes every 5 years

textvar.name: PathMapsLanduse
textvar.comment: Maps for land use fractions and related land use maps

textvar.name: PathWaterUse
textvar.comment: Water use maps path $(PathMaps)/waterdemand19902014

textvar.name: PathMeteo
textvar.comment: ./meteoWatch Meteo path

textvar.name: PathLAI
textvar.comment: Leaf Area Index maps path

textvar.name: PathVarWaterfraction
textvar.comment: variable water fraction maps path

textvar.name: timestepInit
textvar.comment: if init. condition are stored as netCDF with different time steps this variable indicates which time step to use Either as date e.g. 1/1/2010 or as number e.g. 5

textvar.name: OFDirectInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], direct runoff fraction

textvar.name: OFOtherInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], other fraction

textvar.name: OFForestInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], forest fraction

textvar.name: SnowCoverAInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone A [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverBInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone B [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverCInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone C [mm]

textvar.name: FrostIndexInitValue
textvar.comment: initial Frost Index value [degC/day]

textvar.name: CumIntInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZInitValue
textvar.comment: water in upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall [days]

group.comment: ************************************************************** The following variables can also be initialized in the model internally. if you want this to happen set them to bogus value of -9999 **************************************************************

textvar.name: LZInitValue
textvar.comment: water in lower store [mm] -9999: use steady-state storage

textvar.name: TotalCrossSectionAreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial cross-sectional area of flow in channel[m2] -9999: use half bankfull

textvar.name: ThetaInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content layer 1a (superficial soil layer) [mm3/mm3] -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content layer 1b (upper soil layer) [mm3/mm3] -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content layer 2 (lower soil layer) [mm3/mm3] -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: CrossSection2AreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial channel cross-section area [m2] for 2nd routing channel -9999: use 0

textvar.name: PrevSideflowInitValue
textvar.comment: initial lateral inflow for 1st line of routing [m2/s] -9999: use 0

textvar.name: LakeInitialLevelValue
textvar.comment: Initial lake level [m] -9999 sets initial value to steady-state level

textvar.name: LakePrevInflowValue
textvar.comment: Lake inflow at previous routing sub-step (ChanQ(t-1)) [m3/s] -9999 sets initial value equal to PrevDischarge (ChanQ(t))

textvar.name: LakePrevOutflowValue
textvar.comment: Lake outflow at previous routing sub-step (ChanQ(t-1)) [m3/s] -9999 sets initial value

textvar.name: PrevDischarge
textvar.comment: initial discharge [m3/s] from previous run for lakes, reservoirs and transmission loss ChanQ only needed for lakes reservoirs and transmission loss -9999: use 0

textvar.name: CumIntForestInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZForestInitValue
textvar.comment: water in upper groundwater store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRForestInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: CumIntIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: CumIntSealedInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: PrefixPrecipitation
textvar.comment: prefix precipitation maps

textvar.name: PrefixTavg
textvar.comment: prefix average temperature maps

textvar.name: PrefixE0
textvar.comment: prefix E0 maps

textvar.name: PrefixES0
textvar.comment: prefix ES0 maps

textvar.name: PrefixET0
textvar.comment: prefix ET0 maps

textvar.name: PrefixLAIOther
textvar.comment: prefix LAI maps

textvar.name: PrefixLAIForest
textvar.comment: prefix LAI forest maps

textvar.name: PrefixLAIIrrigation
textvar.comment: prefix LAI irrigation maps

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseDomestic
textvar.comment: prefix domestic water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseLivestock
textvar.comment: prefix livestock water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseEnergy
textvar.comment: prefix energy water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseIndustry
textvar.comment: prefix industry water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixVarWaterFraction
textvar.comment: prefix variable water fraction

group.comment:
************************************************************** SNOW AND FROST RELATED PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- estimate SnowFactor from prior data (if available), otherwise use 1 - use SnowMeltCoef as a calibration constant - leave all other parameters at default

textvar.name: SnowFactor
textvar.comment: Multiplier [-] applied to precipitation that falls as snow

textvar.name: SnowSeasonAdj
textvar.comment: range [mm C-1 day-1] of the seasonal variation SnowMeltCoef is the average value

textvar.name: TempMelt
textvar.comment: Average temperature [deg C] at which snow melts

textvar.name: TempSnow
textvar.comment: Average temperature [deg C] below which precipitation is snow

textvar.name: TemperatureLapseRate
textvar.comment: Temperature lapse rate with altitude [C / m]

textvar.name: Afrost
textvar.comment: Daily decay coefficient [day-1], (Handbook of Hydrology, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: Kfrost
textvar.comment: Snow depth reduction coefficient, [cm-1], (HH, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: SnowWaterEquivalent
textvar.comment: Snow water equivalent, (based on snow density of 450 kg/m3) (e.g. Tarboton and Luce, 1996)

textvar.name: FrostIndexThreshold
textvar.comment: Degree Days Frost Threshold (stops infiltration, percolation and capillary rise) Molnau and Bissel found a value 56-85 for NW USA.

textvar.name: IrrigationEfficiency
textvar.comment: 0.75 Field application irrigation efficiency [-]: max 1, ~0.90 drip irrigation, ~0.75 sprinkling

textvar.name: ConveyanceEfficiency
textvar.comment: conveyance efficiency [-]: around 0.80 for average channel

textvar.name: IrrigationType
textvar.comment: IrrigationType (value between 0 and 1) is used here to distinguish between additional adding water until fieldcapacity (value set to 1) or not (value set to 0)

textvar.name: IrrigationMult
textvar.comment: Factor [-] to irrigation water demand More than the transpiration is added e.g to prevent salinisation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseM3
textvar.comment: Annual amount (m3) of treated wastewater reused for irrigation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseNumDays
textvar.comment: Number of days over which the annual amount of treated wastewater for irrigation is used

textvar.name: LivestockConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for livestock water use (0-1) [-]

textvar.name: IndustryConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for industrial water use (0-1) [-]

textvar.name: EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: # Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for energy water use (0-1) [-] # Source: Torcellini et al. (2003) "Consumptive Use for US Power Production" # map advised by Neil Edwards, Energy Industry # the UK and small French rivers the consumptive use varies between 1:2 and 1:3, so 0.33-0.50 # For plants along big rivers like Rhine and Danube the 0.025 is ok EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction=0.025

textvar.name: DomesticConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for domestic water use (0-1) [-] Source: EEA (2005) State of Environment

textvar.name: LeakageFraction
textvar.comment: 0.2 $(PathMaps)/leakage.nc Fraction of leakage of public water supply (0=no leakage, 1=100% leakage)

textvar.name: LeakageWaterLoss
textvar.comment: The water that is lost from leakage (lost) (0-1) [-]

textvar.name: LeakageReductionFraction
textvar.comment: Leakage reduction fraction (e.g. 50% = 0.5 as compared to current Leakage) (baseline=0, maximum=1) [-]

textvar.name: WaterSavingFraction
textvar.comment: Water savings fraction (e.g. 10% = 0.1 as compared to current Use (baseline=0, maximum=1) [-] scenwsav.nc

textvar.name: WaterReUseFraction
textvar.comment: Fraction of water re-used in industry (e.g. 50% = 0.5 = half of the water is re-used, used twice (baseline=0, maximum=1) [-] scenruse.nc

textvar.name: FirstDayOfMonth
textvar.comment: table with days for each water use maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of wuse map

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropCoef
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop coefficient [-]

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropGroupNumber
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop group number [-]

textvar.name: Population
textvar.comment: Population [units]

textvar.name: PopulationMaps
textvar.comment: Population

textvar.name: LandUseMask
textvar.comment: Land Use Mask

textvar.name: WaterUseMaps
textvar.comment: Reported water use [cu m/s], depending on the availability of discharge

textvar.name: WaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Time series of upstream water use at gauging stations

textvar.name: StepsWaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Number of sub-steps needed for water use routine

textvar.name: maxNoWateruse
textvar.comment: maximum number of loops for calculating the use of water = distance water is taken for water consuption

textvar.name: WUsePercRemain
textvar.comment: percentage of water which remains in the channel e.g. 0.2 -> 20 percent of discharge is not taken out

group.comment:
************************************************************** GROUNDWATER RELATED PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- leave GwLossFraction at 0 unless prior information show groundwater loss is important - use UpperZoneTimeConstant, LowerZoneTimeConstant, GwPercValue as calibration constants - calibrate on GwLossFraction if necessary

textvar.name: LZSmoothRange
textvar.comment: length of the window used to smooth the LZ zone [number of cell length]

textvar.name: GroundwaterBodies
textvar.comment: $(PathMaps)/gwbodiesNew.nc map of aquifers (0/1), used to smoothen LZ near extraction areas

textvar.name: FracMaxWater
textvar.comment: Fraction of maximum extend of water

textvar.name: LakeMask
textvar.comment: Mask with Lakes from GLWD database

group.comment:
************************************************************** TRANSMISSION LOSS PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- Use TransSub as calibration constant leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: TransSub
textvar.comment: Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransPower1
textvar.comment: PBchange Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransArea
textvar.comment: PBchange downstream area taking into account for transmission loss

textvar.name: UpAreaTrans
textvar.comment: upstream area

group.comment:
************************************************************** ROUTING PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- Use CalChanMan as calibration constant to fine-tune timing of channel routing, leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: beta
textvar.comment: kinematic wave parameter beta [-]: 0.6 is for broad sheet flow

textvar.name: OFDepRef
textvar.comment: Reference depth of overland flow [mm], used to compute overland flow Alpha for kin. wave

textvar.name: GradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum slope gradient [-] (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

textvar.name: ChanGradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum channel gradient [-] (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

group.comment:
************************************************************** PARAMETERS RELATED TO NUMERICS **************************************************************
Important: do not change, default value of 0.4 generally combines sufficient numerical accuracy within a limited number of sub-steps

textvar.name: CourantCrit
textvar.comment: Minimum value for Courant condition in soil moisture routine. Always less than or equal to 1. Small values result in improved numerical accuracy, at the expense of increased computing time (more sub-steps needed). If reported time series of soil moisture contain large jumps, lowering CourantCrit should fix this

group.comment: ************************************************************** VARIABLES RELATED TO OPTIONS These all need to have some (real or bogus) value, even for options that are not actually used! **************************************************************

textvar.name: DtSecReservoirs
textvar.comment: Sub time step used for reservoir simulation [s]. Within the model, the smallest out of DtSecReservoirs and DtSec is used.

textvar.name: ReservoirInitialFillValue
textvar.comment: Initial reservoir fill fraction [-] -9999 sets initial fill to normal storage limit if you're not using the reservoir option, enter some bogus value

textvar.name: TabLakeAvNetInflowEstimate
textvar.comment: Estimate of average net inflow into lake (=inflow - evaporation) [cu m / s] Used to calculated steady-state lake level in case LakeInitialLevelValue is set to -9999

textvar.name: mu
textvar.comment: Weir constant [-] (Do not change!)

textvar.name: PolderInitialLevelValue
textvar.comment: Initial water level in polder [m]

textvar.name: CourantDynamicCrit
textvar.comment: Critical Courant number for dynamic wave value between 0-1 (smaller values result in greater numerical accuracy, but also increase computational time)

textvar.name: DynWaveConstantHeadBoundary
textvar.comment: Constant head [m] at most downstream pixel (relative to altitude at most downstream pixel)

textvar.name: InflowPoints
textvar.comment: OPTIONAL: nominal map with locations of (measured) inflow hydrographs [cu m / s]

textvar.name: QInTS
textvar.comment: OPTIONAL: observed or simulated input hydrographs as time series [cu m / s] Note that identifiers in time series correspond to InflowPoints map (also optional)

textvar.name: HeadMax
textvar.comment: Maximum capillary head [cm]. This value is used if Theta equals residual soil moisture content (value of HeadMax is arbitrary). Only needed for pF computation, otherwise doesn't influence model results at all)

textvar.name: PF1OtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1a, other fraction

textvar.name: PF2OtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1b, other fraction

textvar.name: PF3OtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 2, other fraction

textvar.name: PF1ForestMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1a, forest fraction

textvar.name: PF2ForestMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1b, forest fraction

textvar.name: PF3ForestMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF layer 2, forest fraction

textvar.name: PF1IrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1a, irrigation fraction

textvar.name: PF2IrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1b, irrigation fraction

textvar.name: PF3IrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 2, irrigation fraction

textvar.name: proj4_params
textvar.comment: This is necessary when using projected coordinates (x,y)

textvar.name: MaskMap
textvar.comment: Clone map

textvar.name: netCDFtemplate
textvar.comment: netcdf template used to copy metadata information for writing netcdf

textvar.name: Latitude
textvar.comment: latitude map to be used for snow/ice modelling

textvar.name: CalendarConvention
textvar.comment: Calendar convention

textvar.name: CalendarDayStart
textvar.comment: Calendar day is back! Calendar day number of 1st day in model run e.g. 1st of January: 1; 1st of June 151 (or 152 in leap year) Needed to read out LAI tables correctly

textvar.name: DtSec
textvar.comment: timestep [seconds] (60*60*24)

textvar.name: DtSecChannel
textvar.comment: Sub time step used for kinematic wave channel routing [seconds] Within the model,the smallest out of DtSecChannel and DtSec is used

textvar.name: StepStart
textvar.comment: Number of first time step in simulation

textvar.name: StepEnd
textvar.comment: Number of last time step in simulation

group.comment:
************************************************************** PARAMETERS RELATED TO EVAPO(TRANSPI)RATION AND Interception **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- leave all these parameters at their default values. in some very special cases CalEvaporation may be set to some value other than one

textvar.name: PrScaling
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to potential precipitation rates [-]

textvar.name: CalEvaporation
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to potential evapo(transpi)ration rates [-]

textvar.name: LeafDrainageTimeConstant
textvar.comment: Time constant for water in interception store [days]

group.textvar:
>
Average extinction coefficient [-] for the diffuse radiation flux varies with crop from 0.4 to 1.1 (Goudriaan (1977))

textvar.name: AvWaterRateThreshold
textvar.comment: Critical amount of available water (expressed in [mm/day]!), above which 'Days Since Last Rain' parameter is set to 1

textvar.name: SMaxSealed
textvar.comment: maximum depression storage for water on impervious surface which is not immediatly causing surface runoff [mm]

group.comment:
************************************************************** SNOW AND FROST RELATED PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- estimate SnowFactor from prior data (if available), otherwise use 1 - use SnowMeltCoef as a calibration constant - leave all other parameters at default

textvar.name: SnowFactor
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to precipitation that falls as snow

textvar.name: SnowMeltCoef
textvar.comment: Snowmelt coefficient [mm C-1 day-1)] See also Martinec et al., 1998.

textvar.name: SnowSeasonAdj
textvar.comment: range [mm C-1 day-1] of the seasonal variation SnowMeltCoef is the average value

textvar.name: TempMelt
textvar.comment: Average temperature [deg C] at which snow melts

textvar.name: TempSnow
textvar.comment: Average temperature [deg C] below which precipitation is snow

textvar.name: TemperatureLapseRate
textvar.comment: Temperature lapse rate with altitude [deg C / m]

textvar.name: Afrost
textvar.comment: Daily decay coefficient [day-1], (Handbook of Hydrology, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: Kfrost
textvar.comment: Snow depth reduction coefficient, [cm-1], (HH, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: SnowWaterEquivalent
textvar.comment: Snow water equivalent, (based on snow density of 450 kg/m3) (e.g. Tarboton and Luce, 1996)

textvar.name: FrostIndexThreshold
textvar.comment: Degree Days Frost Threshold (stops infiltration, percolation and capillary rise) Molnau and Bissel found a value 56-85 for NW USA.

group.comment:
************************************************************** INFILTRATION PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- use b_Xinanjiang and PowerPrefFlow as calibration constants

textvar.name: b_Xinanjiang
textvar.comment: Power in Xinanjiang distribution function [-]

textvar.name: PowerPrefFlow
textvar.comment: Power that controls increase of proportion of preferential flow with increased soil moisture storage [-]

group.comment:
************************************************************** GROUNDWATER RELATED PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- leave GwLossFraction at 0 unless prior information show groundwater loss is important - use all other parameters as calibration constants

textvar.name: UpperZoneTimeConstant
textvar.comment: Time constant for water in upper zone [days]

textvar.name: LowerZoneTimeConstant
GwPercValue
textvar.comment: Maximum rate of percolation going from the Upper to the Lower response box [mm/day]

textvar.name: GwLoss
textvar.comment: Maximum percolation rate from the lower groundwater zone [mm/days]. GWLoss it’s lost beyond the catchment boundaries or to deep groundwater systems. A value of 0 (closed lower boundary) is recommended as a starting value.

textvar.name: WFractionMaps
textvar.comment: water use daily maps with a (in this case negative) volume of water [cu m/s]

textvar.name: WFracOfDay
textvar.comment: table with days for each water use maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of wuse map

textvar.name: FracMaxWater
textvar.comment: Percentage of maximum extend of water

textvar.name: LakeMask
textvar.comment: Mask with Lakes from GLWD database

textvar.name: maxNoEva
textvar.comment: maximum number of loops for calculating evaporation = distance water is taken to satisfy the need of evaporation from open water

textvar.name: EvaOpenMaps
textvar.comment: Reported evaporation from open water [mm]

textvar.name: EvaOpenTS
textvar.comment: Time series of upstream water evaporation from open water at gauging stations

group.comment:
************************************************************** TRANSMISSION LOSS PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- Use TransSub as calibration constant leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: TransPower1
textvar.comment: PBchange Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransSub
textvar.comment: PBchange Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransArea
textvar.comment: PBchange downstream area taking into account for transmission loss

textvar.name: UpAreaTrans
textvar.comment: upstream area

group.comment:
************************************************************** ROUTING PARAMETERS **************************************************************
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- Use CalChanMan as calibration constant to fine-tune timing of channel routing, leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: CalChanMan
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to Channel Manning's n

textvar.name: CalChanMan2
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to Channel Manning's n for second routing line

textvar.name: QSplitMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to average Q to split into a second line of routing

textvar.name: ChanBottomWMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to ChanBottomWidth

textvar.name: ChanDepthTMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to ChanDepthThreshold

textvar.name: ChanSMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to ChanSdXdY

textvar.name: beta
textvar.comment: kinematic wave parameter: 0.6 is for broad sheet flow

textvar.name: OFDepRef
textvar.comment: Reference depth of overland flow [mm], used to compute overland flow Alpha for kin. wave

textvar.name: GradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum slope gradient (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

textvar.name: ChanGradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum channel gradient (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

group.comment:
************************************************************** PARAMETERS RELATED TO NUMERICS **************************************************************
Important: do not change, default value of 0.4 generally combines sufficient numerical accuracy within a limited number of sub-steps

textvar.name: CourantCrit
textvar.comment: Minimum value for Courant condition in soil moisture routine. Always less than or equal to 1. Small values result in improved numerical accuracy, at the expense of increased computing time (more sub-steps needed). If reported time series of soil moisture contain large jumps, lowering CourantCrit should fix this

textvar.name: LZAvInflowMap
textvar.comment: $(PathOut)/lzavin.nc Reported map of average percolation rate from upper to lower groundwater zone (reported for end of simulation) [mm/day]

textvar.name: AvgDis
textvar.comment: $(PathMaps)/avgdis.nc $(PathInit)/avgdis.nc CHANNEL split routing in two lines Average discharge map [m3/s]

textvar.name: timestepInit
textvar.comment: if init condition are stored as netCDF with different time steps this variable indicates which time step to use Either as date e.g. 1/1/2010 or as number e.g. 5

textvar.name: OFDirectInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], direct runoff fraction

textvar.name: OFOtherInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], other fraction

textvar.name: OFForestInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], forest fraction

textvar.name: SnowCoverAInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone A [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverBInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone B [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverCInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone C [mm]

textvar.name: FrostIndexInitValue
textvar.comment: initial Frost Index value [degC/day]

textvar.name: CumIntInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall

group.comment: ************************************************************** The following variables can also be initialized in the model internally. if you want this to happen set them to bogus value of -9999 **************************************************************

textvar.name: LZInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater lower store [mm] -9999: use steady-state storage

textvar.name: TotalCrossSectionAreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial cross-sectional area of flow in channel[m2] -9999: use half bankfull

textvar.name: ThetaInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: CrossSection2AreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial channel cross-section area [m2] for 2nd routing channel -9999: use 0

textvar.name: PrevSideflowInitValue
textvar.comment: initial lateral inflow for 1st line of routing [m2/s] -9999: use 0

textvar.name: PrevDischarge
textvar.comment: initial discharge [m3/s] from previous run for lakes, reservoirs and transmission loss only needed for lakes reservoirs and transmission loss -9999: use 0

textvar.name: CumIntForestInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZForestInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRForestInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall for forest fraction

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: CumIntSealedInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative depression storage [mm]

textvar.name: CumIntIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall for irrigation

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: PrecipitationMaps
textvar.comment: precipitation [mm/day]

textvar.name: TavgMaps
textvar.comment: average daily temperature [C]

textvar.name: E0Maps
textvar.comment: daily reference evaporation (free water) [mm/day]

textvar.name: ES0Maps
textvar.comment: daily reference evaporation (soil) [mm/day]

textvar.name: ET0Maps
textvar.comment: daily reference evapotranspiration (crop) [mm/day]

textvar.name: LAIOtherMaps
textvar.comment: leaf area index [m2/m2]

textvar.name: LAIForestMaps
textvar.comment: leaf area index [m2/m2]

textvar.name: LAIIrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: leaf area index [m2/m2]

textvar.name: LAIOfDay
textvar.comment: table with days for each LAI maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of LAI map

textvar.name: FirstDayOfMonth
textvar.comment: table with days for each water use maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of wuse map

textvar.name: DomesticDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Domestic water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: LivestockDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Livestock water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: EnergyDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Energy water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: IndustrialDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Industry water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: LivestockConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for livestock water use (0-1)

textvar.name: IndustryConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for industrial water use (0-1)

textvar.name: EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: # Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for energy water use (0-1) # Source: Torcellini et al. (2003) "Consumptive Use for US Power Production" # map advised by Neil Edwards, Energy Industry # the UK and small French rivers the consumptive use varies between 1:2 and 1:3, so 0.33-0.50 # For plants along big rivers like Rhine and Danube the 0.025 is ok EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction=0.025

textvar.name: DomesticConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for domestic water use (0-1) Source: EEA (2005) State of Environment

textvar.name: LeakageFraction
textvar.comment: Fraction of leakage of public water supply (0=no leakage, 1=100% leakage)

textvar.name: LeakageWaterLoss
textvar.comment: The water that is lost from leakage (lost) (0-1)

textvar.name: LeakageReductionFraction
textvar.comment: Leakage reduction fraction (e.g. 50% = 0.5 as compared to current Leakage) (baseline=0, maximum=1)

textvar.name: WaterSavingFraction
textvar.comment: Water savings fraction (e.g. 10% = 0.1 as compared to current Use (baseline=0, maximum=1) scenwsav.nc

textvar.name: WaterReUseFraction
textvar.comment: Fraction of water re-used in industry (e.g. 50% = 0.5 = half of the water is re-used, used twice (baseline=0, maximum=1 scenruse.nc

textvar.name: IrrigationEfficiency
textvar.comment: Field application irrigation efficiency max 1, ~0.90 drip irrigation, ~0.75 sprinkling

textvar.name: ConveyanceEfficiency
textvar.comment: conveyance efficiency, around 0.80 for average channel

textvar.name: IrrigationType
textvar.comment: IrrigationType (value between 0 and 1) is used here to distinguish between additional adding water until fieldcapacity (value set to 1) or not (value set to 0)

textvar.name: IrrigationMult
textvar.comment: Factor to irrigation water demand More than the transpiration is added e.g to prevent salinisation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseM3
textvar.comment: Annual amount (m3) of treated wastewater reused for irrigation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseNumDays
textvar.comment: Number of days over which the annual amount of treated wastewater for irrigation is used

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropCoef
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop coefficient

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropGroupNumber
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop group number

textvar.name: Population
textvar.comment: Population

textvar.name: PopulationMaps
textvar.comment: Population

textvar.name: LandUseMask
textvar.comment: Land Use Mask

textvar.name: WaterUseMaps
textvar.comment: Reported water use [cu m/s], depending on the availability of discharge

textvar.name: WaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Time series of upstream water use at gauging stations

textvar.name: StepsWaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Number of sub-steps needed for water use routine

textvar.name: maxNoWateruse
textvar.comment: maximum number of loops for calculating the use of water = distance water is taken for water consuption

textvar.name: WUsePercRemain
textvar.comment: percentage of water which remains in the channel e.g. 0.2 -> 20 percent of discharge is not taken out

textvar.name: RiceFlooding
textvar.comment: water amount in mm per day 10 mm for 10 days (total 10cm water)

textvar.name: RicePercolation
textvar.comment: FAO: percolation for heavy clay soils: PERC = 2 mm/day

textvar.name: RicePlantingDay1
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: RiceHarvestDay1
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: RicePlantingDay2
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: RiceHarvestDay2
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: DischargeMaps
textvar.comment: Reported discharge [cu m/s] (average over the model timesteps) (AvgDis)

textvar.name: TopSoilMoistureMaps
textvar.comment: Reported Topsoil moisture [%]

textvar.name: SurfaceSoilMoistureMaps
textvar.comment: Reported Topsoil moisture [%]

textvar.name: DisMaps
textvar.comment: Reported discharge [cu m/s] at the end of a timestep

textvar.name: MaskDischargeMaps
textvar.comment: Reported discharge [cu m/s] but cut by a discharge mask map

textvar.name: WaterLevelMaps
textvar.comment: Reported water level [m] % False by default

group.comment: STATE VARIABLES AT SELECTED TIME STEPS ONLY FOR INITIALISATION OF SUCCEEDING RUNS REPORTING TIME STEPS SET THROUGH "ReportSteps" OPTION

textvar.name: Theta1State
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1a (superficial layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta2State
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1b (upper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta3State
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 2 (lower layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: UZState
textvar.comment: Reported storage in upper response box [mm]

textvar.name: LZState
textvar.comment: Reported storage in lower response box [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRState
textvar.comment: Reported days since last rain

textvar.name: WaterDepthState
textvar.comment: Reported water depth

textvar.name: OFDirectState
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for direct fraction on catchment surface

textvar.name: OFOtherState
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for other fraction on catchment surface

textvar.name: OFForestState
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for forest fraction on catchment surface

textvar.name: ChanCrossSectionState
textvar.comment: Reported chan cross-section area [m2]

textvar.name: SnowCoverAState
textvar.comment: Reported snow cover in snow zone A [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverBState
textvar.comment: Reported snow cover in snow zone B [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverCState
textvar.comment: Reported snow cover in snow zone C [mm]

textvar.name: FrostIndexState
textvar.comment: Reported frost index [degC/day]

textvar.name: CumInterceptionState
textvar.comment: Reported interception storage [mm]

textvar.name: CrossSection2State
textvar.comment: Reported cross section area 2nd line of routing [m2]

textvar.name: ChSideState
textvar.comment: Reported channel side flow [m2/s]

textvar.name: ChanQState
textvar.comment: Reported istantaneous discharge at end of computation step [cu m/s] ChanQ

textvar.name: DSLRForestState
textvar.comment: Reported days since last rain

textvar.name: CumInterceptionForestState
textvar.comment: Reported interception storage [mm]

textvar.name: Theta1ForestState
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1a (superficial layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta2ForestState
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1b (upper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta3ForestState
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 2 (lower layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: UZForestState
textvar.comment: Reported storage in upper response box [mm]

textvar.name: CumIntSealedState
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRIrrigationState
textvar.comment: Reported days since last rain

textvar.name: CumInterceptionIrrigationState
textvar.comment: Reported interception storage [mm]

textvar.name: Theta1IrrigationState
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1a (superficial layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta2IrrigationState
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 1b (upper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta3IrrigationState
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 2 (lowerupper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: UZIrrigationState
textvar.comment: Reported storage in upper response box [mm]

textvar.name: TaOtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported transpiration maps, other fraction [mm]

textvar.name: TaForestMapa
textvar.comment: Reported transpiration maps, forest fraction [mm]

textvar.name: TaIrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: Reported transpiration maps, irrigated fraction [mm]

textvar.name: TaPixelMaps
textvar.comment: Reported transpiration maps, weighted sum over the fractions of each pixel [mm]

group.comment: "END" MAPS, AKA REPORTED OUTPUT MAPS CALLED "END" Same as above, but always at last time step Support for these "end" maps will most likely be discontinued some time soon

textvar.name: Theta1End
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1a (superficial layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta2End
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 1b (upper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta3End
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 2 (lower layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: UZEnd
textvar.comment: Reported storage in upper response box [mm]

textvar.name: LZEnd
textvar.comment: Reported storage in lower response box [mm]

textvar.name: DSLREnd
textvar.comment: Reported days since last rain

textvar.name: WaterDepthEnd
textvar.comment: Reported water depth [m]

textvar.name: OFDirectEnd
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for direct fraction on catchment surface

textvar.name: OFOtherEnd
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for other fraction on catchment surface

textvar.name: OFForestEnd
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for forest fraction on catchment surface

textvar.name: ChanCrossSectionEnd
textvar.comment: Reported chan cross-section area [m2]

textvar.name: SnowCoverAEnd
textvar.comment: Reported snow cover in snow zone A [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverBEnd
textvar.comment: Reported snow cover in snow zone B [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverCEnd
textvar.comment: Reported snow cover in snow zone C [mm]

textvar.name: FrostIndexEnd
textvar.comment: Reported frost index [degC/day]

textvar.name: CumInterceptionEnd
textvar.comment: Reported interception storage [mm]

textvar.name: LakeLevelEnd
textvar.comment: Reported lake level [m]

textvar.name: LakePrevInflowEnd
textvar.comment: Reported lake inflow at previous routing sub-step (ChanQ(t-1)) [m3/s] -9999 sets initial value equal to PrevDischarge (ChanQ(t))

textvar.name: LakePrevOutflowEnd
textvar.comment: Reported lake outflow at previous routing sub-step (ChanQ(t-1)) [m3/s] -9999 sets initial value

textvar.name: LakeStorageM3
textvar.comment: Reported lake storage [m3]

textvar.name: ReservoirFillEnd
textvar.comment: Reported reservoir filling [-]

textvar.name: CrossSection2End
textvar.comment: Reported cross section area 2nd line of rounting [m2]

textvar.name: ChSideEnd
textvar.comment: Reported channel side flow [m2/s]

textvar.name: ChanQEnd
textvar.comment: Reported istantaneous discharge at end of computation step [cu m/s] ChanQ

textvar.name: DischargeEnd
textvar.comment: Reported discharge [cu m/s] (average over the model timesteps) (AvgDis)

textvar.name: DSLRForestEnd
textvar.comment: Reported days since last rain

textvar.name: CumInterceptionForestEnd
textvar.comment: Reported interception storage [mm]

textvar.name: Theta1ForestEnd
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1a (superficial layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta2ForestEnd
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 1b (upper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta3ForestEnd
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 2 (lower layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: UZForestEnd
textvar.comment: Reported storage in upper response box [mm]

textvar.name: CumIntSealedEnd
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRIrrigationEnd
textvar.comment: Reported days since last rain

textvar.name: CumInterceptionIrrigationEnd
textvar.comment: Reported interception storage [mm]

textvar.name: Theta1IrrigationEnd
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1a (superficial layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta2IrrigationEnd
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 1b (upper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta3IrrigationEnd
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for both soil layer 1c (lower layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: UZIrrigationEnd
textvar.comment: Reported storage in upper response box [mm]

group.comment: INDIVIDUAL DRIVING METEOROLOGICAL VARIABLES (AT EVERY TIME STEP) ONLY IF REPORTING OF EACH RESPECTIVE VARIABLE IS SWITCHED ON (DEFAULT: ALL SWITCHED OFF) Note reporting is done as a quantity per time step, not as an intensity (as in meteo input!)

textvar.name: PrecipitationMapsOut
textvar.comment: Precipitation [mm per time step]

textvar.name: TavgMapsOut
textvar.comment: Average DAILY temperature [degrees C]

textvar.name: ETRefMapsOut
textvar.comment: Potential reference evapotranspiration [mm per time step]

textvar.name: ESRefMapsOut
textvar.comment: Potential evaporation from bare soil surface [mm per time step]

textvar.name: EWRefMapsOut
textvar.comment: Potential evaporation from open water surface [mm per time step]

group.comment: INDIVIDUAL STATE VARIABLES (AT EVERY TIME STEP) ONLY IF REPORTING OF EACH RESPECTIVE VARIABLE IS SWITCHED ON (DEFAULT: ALL SWITCHED OFF)

textvar.name: Theta1Maps
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1a (superficial layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta2Maps
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 1b (upper layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: Theta3Maps
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for soil layer 2 (lower layer) [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: ThetaMaps
textvar.comment: Reported volumetric soil moisture content for combined soil layer 1 and 2 [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: UZMaps
textvar.comment: Reported storage in upper response box [mm]

textvar.name: LZMaps
textvar.comment: Reported storage in lower response box [mm]

textvar.name: LZMaps0
textvar.comment: Reported storage in lower response box [mm]

textvar.name: LZMaps1
textvar.comment: Reported storage in lower response box [mm]

textvar.name: LZMaps2
textvar.comment: Reported storage in lower response box [mm]

textvar.name: LZMaps3
textvar.comment: Reported storage in lower response box [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRMaps
textvar.comment: Reported days since last rain

textvar.name: WaterDepthMaps
textvar.comment: Reported water depth [m]

textvar.name: OFDirectMaps
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for direct runoff fraction on catchment surfac

textvar.name: OFOtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for other fraction on catchment surfac

textvar.name: OFForestMaps
textvar.comment: Reported overland flow water volume [m3] for forest fraction on catchment surfac

textvar.name: ChanCrossSectionMaps
textvar.comment: Reported channel cross-section area [m2]

textvar.name: SnowCoverMaps
textvar.comment: Reported snow cover [mm]

textvar.name: FrostIndexMaps
textvar.comment: Reported frost index [degC/day]

textvar.name: CumInterceptionMaps
textvar.comment: Reported interception storage, other fraction [mm]
